tqi.name: Security
tqi.description: A representation of the static vulnerabilies and weaknesses of a CSharp project or solution.

characteristic.name: Confidentiality
characteristic.description: Degree to which a product or system ensures that data are accessible only to those authorized to have access.

characteristic.name: Integrity
characteristic.description: Degree to which a system, product or component prevents unauthorized access to, or modification of, computer programs or data.

characteristic.name: Non-repudiation
characteristic.description: Degree to which actions or events can be proven to have taken place, so that the events or actions cannot be repudiated later.

characteristic.name: Accountability
characteristic.description: Degree to which the actions of an entity can be traced uniquely to the entity.

characteristic.name: Authenticity
characteristic.description: Degree to which the identity of a subject or resource can be proved to be the one claimed.

property.name: Injection
property.description: Injection flaws occur when an attacker can send hostile data to an interpreter.

property.name: Cryptography
property.description: Cryptography flaws involve vulnerabilities to decrpting content through flaws such as invalidated certificates, weak hashing functions, and weak cipher algorithms.

property.name: Cookies
property.description: Cookie flaws involve incorrect flagging of cookies and insecure passing of information.

property.name: Request Validation
property.description: Disabled or incorrectly configured request validation that causes XSS vulnerability.

property.name: Password Management
property.description: Hard coded, short, or trivial password configuration.
